commonPatterns.description: Basic required phone field with US default
International phone field with flexible validation

validationRules.labelss: Required - Field label displayed to user
validationRules.reqTgl: Optional - Set true for required field (adds asterisk to label)
validationRules.patt: Optional - Regex pattern for validation (default: '^\d{3} \d{3} \d{4}$' for US)
validationRules.defCountry: Optional - Default country code (e.g., 'US', 'GB', 'IN', '' for none)
validationRules.phnIcons: Required if phnIconType='fontAwesome' - Font Awesome class
validationRules.phnImage: Required if phnIconType='image' - Object with url and Id
validationRules.hlpTxt: Optional - Must be true to enable help text
validationRules.desctxt: Required if hlpTxt=true - Help text content
validationRules.countryWidth: Optional - Responsive width for country dropdown (default varies, 80-120px recommended)
validationRules.error: Optional - Custom error message (shown on validation failure)

warnings: ‚ö†Ô∏è PARENT REQUIRED: nxt-phone-field MUST be placed inside tp-form-block (ancestor requirement)
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON TYPE: phnIconType must be set before phnIcons or phnImage will work
‚ö†Ô∏è PATTERN VALIDATION: patt uses regex - ensure proper escaping (\d for digits, \\ for backslash)
‚ö†Ô∏è COUNTRY CODES: defCountry uses ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes (US, GB, CA, AU, IN, etc.)
‚ö†Ô∏è COUNTRY WIDTH: countryWidth affects dropdown width - too narrow cuts off country names
‚ö†Ô∏è HELP TEXT: hlpTxt must be true for desctxt to display
‚ö†Ô∏è STYLING: Label, input, button styling controlled by parent tp-form-block (lblClr, inpClr, etc.)
‚ö†Ô∏è ERROR MESSAGE: Custom error message only shows when reqTgl=true and phone is empty/invalid on submit
‚ö†Ô∏è RESPONSIVE WIDTH: inpSz uses md/sm/xs breakpoints - always set mobile (xs) to 100% for better UX
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON COLOR: icnClr and hvrIcnClr only work with phnIconType='fontAwesome', not with image icons
‚ö†Ô∏è IMAGE ICON SIZE: Custom image icons should be 24x24px or 32x32px for optimal display
‚ö†Ô∏è AUTOCOMPLETE: Use 'tel' for general phone, 'tel-national' for national format, 'tel-local' for local
‚ö†Ô∏è PATTERN DEFAULT: Default pattern (^\d{3} \d{3} \d{4}$) is US-specific - change for other regions
commonMistakes: ‚ùå Forgetting to escape backslashes in patt (use \\d not \d in JSON)
‚ùå Using invalid country codes (use ISO alpha-2: 'US' not 'USA', 'GB' not 'UK')
‚ùå Setting countryWidth too narrow (50px cuts off country names - use 80-120px)
‚ùå Not changing patt when changing defCountry (US pattern won't work for UK numbers)
‚ùå Setting hlpTxt=false but adding desctxt (help text won't show)
‚ùå Forgetting to set phnIconType before adding icon (icons won't appear)
‚ùå Expecting icon color change with image icons (only works with fontAwesome)
‚ùå Not testing responsive widths on mobile (fields should be full-width on xs breakpoint)
‚ùå Using generic error message 'Required' instead of specific 'Please enter a valid phone number'
‚ùå Placing phone field outside tp-form-block parent (block won't render correctly)
‚ùå Not setting autoComplete='tel' (missing out on browser autofill UX)
bestPractices: ‚úÖ Always set autoComplete='tel' for better UX (browser autofill saves user time)
‚úÖ Choose defCountry based on your primary audience region
‚úÖ Set countryWidth to 80-120px for good balance (80px minimal, 120px for full country names)
‚úÖ Use patt appropriate to defCountry (US: '^\d{3} \d{3} \d{4}$', UK: '^\d{3,5} \d{4} \d{4}$', International: '^\+?[1-9]\d{1,14}$')
‚úÖ Keep labels concise: 'Phone Number' or 'Mobile' not 'Please Enter Your Phone Number Here'
‚úÖ Add help text for international forms: 'Select country from dropdown if outside [default country]'
‚úÖ Position help text strategically: 'top' for upfront instructions, 'bottom' for additional context
‚úÖ Use icons consistently across form (if phone has icon, name/email should too)
‚úÖ Choose icons that match context: fa-phone for general, fa-mobile-alt for mobile, fa-globe for international
‚úÖ Provide clear, specific error messages: 'Please enter a valid phone number in format: 555 123 4567'
‚úÖ Make phone fields full-width on mobile (inpSz.xs = '100')
‚úÖ For international forms, use flexible pattern: '^\+?[1-9]\d{1,14}$'
‚úÖ Test pattern with various formats from target countries
‚úÖ Use descPoss='bottom' for help text by default (doesn't interfere with label reading flow)
‚úÖ For mobile-specific fields, use 'Mobile Number' label and fa-mobile-alt icon
‚úÖ Combine icon + hover color for polished modern forms

accessibilityNotes: üåê WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance:
- Label must be descriptive and associated with input (labelss attribute)
- Error messages should be specific and actionable (error attribute)
- Required fields marked with asterisk (*) via reqTgl
- Help text provides additional context for screen readers (desctxt)
- autocomplete='tel' improves assistive technology experience
üéØ Focus States:
- Parent tp-form-block controls focus styling (actInpBg, actInpBdr)
- Ensure focus state has 3:1 contrast ratio with background
- Country dropdown must be keyboard accessible (up/down arrows to select)
‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Navigation:
- Tab key moves between country dropdown and phone input
- Enter/Space opens country dropdown
- Up/Down arrows navigate country list
- Type country name to search/filter countries
- Enter key submits form (handled by parent tp-form-block)
üîä Screen Reader Considerations:
- Label read first: 'Phone Number, required, edit text'
- Country dropdown announced: 'Country selector, United States selected'
- Help text read as description
- Error message announced on validation failure: 'Invalid entry, Please enter a valid phone number'
- Icon decorative only (not announced)
üåà Color Contrast:
- Label text must have 4.5:1 contrast with background
- Country dropdown text must have 4.5:1 contrast
- Icon color (icnClr) should have 3:1 contrast if conveying information
- Error messages typically red, but must have sufficient contrast (4.5:1)
üìû Phone-Specific Accessibility:
- Always include 'Phone' or 'Phone Number' in label (don't just use icon)
- Error messages should clarify format: 'Please enter a valid phone number in format: 555 123 4567'
- Help text can explain international usage: 'Select country from dropdown if outside US'
- Country dropdown should support type-ahead search for accessibility
